title: Discriminative models for multi-class object layout.
abstract: Many state-of-the-art approaches for object recognition reduce the problem to a 0-1 classification task. Such reductions allow one to leverage sophisticated classifiers for learning. These models are typically trained independently for each class using positive and negative examples cropped from images. At test-time, various post-processing heuristics such as non-maxima suppression (NMS) are required to reconcile multiple detections within and between different classes for each image. Though crucial to good performance on benchmarks, this post-processing is usually defined heuristically.
